item.title: Florida breaks daily record again...
item.description:

The increase in cases comes as a record 151,725 tests are being reported on average per day as of Dec. 30, the most recent data available for testing rates. The state’s ...

item.title: FDA Drives Racial Rationing of Therapeutics...
item.description:
freebeacon.com
In New York, racial minorities are automatically eligible for scarce COVID-19 treatment, regardless of age or underlying conditions. In Utah, "Latinx ethnicity" counts for more points than "congestive heart failure" in a patient’s "COVID-19 risk score"—the state’s framework for allocating monoclonal antibodies. And in Minnesota, health officials have devised their own "ethical framework" that prioritizes black 18-year-olds over white 64-year-olds—even though the latter are at much higher risk of severe disease.
